intro: Casearia tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange to red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
